content.text: On the grid, complete the scatter diagram to show the Mathematics and English marks for the 10 students. The first four points have been plotted for you
Mathematics mark
What type of correlation does your scatter diagram show?
Answer(a)(ii)
Draw a line of best fit on the grid
Ann missed the English test but scored 22 marks in the Mathematics test
Use your line of best fit to estimate a possible English mark for Ann
Answer(a)(iv)
Show that the mean English mark for the 10 students is 28
Answer(b)
Two new students do the English test. They both score the **same** mark
The mean English mark for the 12 students is 31
Calculate the English mark for the new students
Answer(c)
The table shows the test marks in Mathematics and English for 10 students
In a sale, Jen buys a laptop for \(351.55
This price is \(21\%\) less than the price before the sale
Calculate the price before the sale
Answer(a)
Alex invests $4000 at a rate of \(8\%\) per year simple interest for 2 years
Bob invests $4000 at a rate of \(7.5\%\) per year compound interest for 2 years
Who receives more interest and by how much?
He plants at least 4 lemon trees
Write down an inequality in \(x\) to show this information
Answer(a)(i)
Pablo plants at least 9 orange trees
Write down an inequality in \(y\) to show this information
Answer(a)(ii)
The greatest possible number of trees he can plant is 20
Write down an inequality in \(x\) and \(y\) to show this information
Answer(a)(iii)
Lemon trees cost \(5 each and orange trees cost\) 10 each
The maximum Pablo can spend is \(\)170
Write down an inequality in \(x\) and \(y\) and show that it simplifies to \(x + 2y \leqslant 34\)
Answer (b)
On the grid opposite, draw four lines to show the four inequalities and shade the **unwanted** region
Pablo plants \(x\) lemon trees and \(y\) orange trees
\(A, B, C, D, E\) and \(F\) are points on the circumference of a circle centre \(O\)
\(AE\) is a diameter of the circle
\(BC\) is parallel to \(AE\) and angle \(CAE = 42^{\circ}\)
Giving a reason for each answer, find
Calculate the smallest cost when Pablo buys a total of 20 trees
Answer(c)(ii)
inner's
\(P\) is the point (2, 5) and \(\overrightarrow{PQ} = \left( \begin{array}{c}3 \\ - 2 \end{array} \right).\)

\(O\) is the origin and \(OABC\) is a parallelogram
\(M\) is the midpoint of \(AB\)
\(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}, \overrightarrow{OA} = 3\mathbf{a}\) and \(CE = \frac{1}{3} CB\)
\(OED\) is a straight line with \(OE:ED = 2:1\)
Find in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\), in their simplest forms
Write down two facts about the lines \(CD\) and \(OB\)
Answer (c)
The probability that it will rain today is \(\frac{1}{3}\)
What is the probability that it will not rain today?
Answer(a)(i)
If it rains today, the probability that it will rain tomorrow is \(\frac{2}{5}\)
If it does not rain today, the probability that it will rain tomorrow is \(\frac{1}{6}\)
Complete the tree diagram
Find the probability that it will rain on at least one of these two days
Answer(b)
Find the probability that it will rain on only one of these two days
Answer(c)
In all parts of this question give your answer as a fraction in its lowest terms
The diagram is a scale drawing of a park \(EFGH\). The scale is \(1:10 000\)
A statue is to be placed in the park so that it is
nearer to \(G\) than to \(H\)
nearer to \(HG\) than to \(FG\)
more than 550 metres from \(F\)
Construct accurately the boundaries of the region \(R\) in which the statue can be placed
Leave in all your construction arcs and shade the region \(R\)
Answer(a)(i)
Answer(a)(ii)
Simplify
Multiply out and simplify

Make \(h\) the subject of
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form

Calculate the area of a circle with radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
Answer(a) cm
A circular cake has radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(7\mathrm{cm}\)
The uniform cross-section of a slice of the cake is a sector with angle \(22^{\circ}\)
The top and the curved surface of the slice, shaded in the diagram, are covered with chocolate
Calculate the area of the slice which is covered with chocolate
Answer(b)
The frame of a child's bicycle is made from metal rods
\(ABC\) is an isosceles triangle with base \(22 \text{cm}\) and base angles \(50^\circ\)
Angle \(ACD = 100^\circ\) and \(CD = 31 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the length \(AD\)
Answer(c) \(AD =\) .........  cm
The cost of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of tomatoes is \(\$ x\) and the cost of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of onions is \(\$ y\)
Ian pays a total of \(\$ 10.70\) for \(10\mathrm{kg}\) of tomatoes and \(4\mathrm{kg}\) of onions
Jao pays a total of \(\$ 10.10\) for \(8\mathrm{kg}\) of tomatoes and \(6\mathrm{kg}\) of onions
Write down simultaneous equations and solve them to find \(x\) and \(y\)
Answer(a) \(x =\)
y =
